titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Hardison and W. M. Suddeth, Judgment
CWG10545

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: Commonwealth v John Hardison & W M Suddeth } F R

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendants being duly summonsed and failing to appear altho solemnly called, It is therefore considered by the court that the Commonwealth of Kentucky recover of the defendants the sum of fifty dollars the amount of the forfeiture of their bond for the appearance of John Groves in said court to answer an indictment found against said Groves in said court and also it is adjudged by the Court that the plantiff recover of the defendant her cost herein expended.

Copy attest
Ben T Perkins C T C C

Respite 12 mo
B. M
Todd Cir. Ct
$50. } Replevin Bond
Jno. Hardison
W. M. Suddeth
Issd May 11. 1861
